name: Turn Block
description: At TurnBlock, we specialise in recruitment for the emerging technologies sector that is poised for growth. We connect talent to leading organizations in blockchain, AI / machine learning, data science & cybersecurity. We recruit for tomorrow’s technology landscape & today staying on the cutting edge of new trends.

jobs.title: Software Engineer (web tech, python)
jobs.description:
Our client works with many of the UK’s most innovative companies, helping them to maximise their government funding opportunities. Their goal is to become the number one provider in the software space, and so we are expanding our team. This rapid growth has created a greater need for technology development in the business and for someone excited about getting involved in all aspects of running and improving our technology infrastructure.

 

As a Software Engineer for Internal Tools, you’ll quickly dive into the codebase of their core internal claims management system and help adapt the system to the changing needs of the business. You’ll be supported by an existing development team of three who will help you get running, and you will be expected to work closely with the operations team and to make decisions on design and implement tools that will increase their productivity. They will encourage and support your learning and development, be it through developer conferences, online courses, external coaching or whatever you decide is right for you.

 

On a typical day, you might:

Write the code for a selected feature request, make a pull request for your code and deploy it.
Talk to a colleague about their recently submitted feature request, work out if the solution presented is the most optimal and effective solution for their problems, then implement and deploy a solution.
Receive a bug report marked as critical and the tool has been failing since the last commit, you fix the bug right away.
Define SQL queries to help the team build reports and identify their work blockers
Help a non-technical colleague understand the technologies in one of our clients technical claims.
 

About the company:
Our client has a unique way of working. In their culture, everyone has the freedom, power, and trust to do their best work. They are a self-managing company, meaning their team can choose where to work, what meetings to attend, and what to work on. They will allow you to explore your potential, and do what you love doing, without the shackles of people managers. Ultimately, they aim to uphold human aliveness and commercial success simultaneously. 

Their culture: everyone has the freedom, power and trust to do their best work. They call it, an open culture. Their way of working aims to uphold human aliveness and commercial success simultaneously; 


 
REQUIREMENTS
 

You’re enthusiastic and able to work autonomously
You have solid experience developing in Web technologies (Javascript, HTML, CSS), Python and SQL.
You know how to deploy to Linux (Shell scripting, Git, etc are all a plus)
You have independently developed and taken solutions from concept to deployment
You’re motivated and willing to learn about and contribute to the wider business
Minimum 3 years of commercial experience
BENEFITS
 

Up to 6 weeks of holiday per year
100% flexible and remote working policy
£2,000 yearly training budget
Pension scheme via The People’s Pension
Phone expenses policy
Company SIP share scheme
Cycle to work scheme
Weekly “lunch force” allowance
Monthly company picnics
Quarterly wellness days and quarterly fun days
****************************************************************************************************************************

ADDITIONAL INFORMATION
 
BENEFITS
Pension, Other(discuss with your HH Account manager)
KEY SKILLS
 

Experience in Web technologies, Javascript, HTML, CSS, Python. SQL,Linux
 

Working Hours:

Standard working hours are 9am - 6pm
Fully Flexible 
Team Setup:

No managers in the business
Flat Hierarchy
Small teams of about 6ish
Autonomous
